Input app op names and/or constants with spaces, e.g. WAKE_LOCK 63 72 CAMERA etc.
Input app op names and/or constants with spaces, e.g. WAKE_LOCK 63 72 CAMERA etc. Use * to apply for all configured app ops.

Backup name should not start with a digit nor should it contain any spaces. Leave it empty if you want to use current date-time.
Adding a preset for backup options removes the burden of selecting flags every time you back up/restore.
Tap to allow App Manager to use OpenPGP

If you have turned off signature verification, you can use the Only install option to install the app without losing data.
Tap to view or send in signatures not yet present in App Manager\'s database of libraries.
Tap to submit the crash report.
The profile name cannot contain any spaces.

Clears the app cache of apps
Custom on/off state for this profile
Input permissions with spaces, e.g. com.permission.GET_ACCOUNTS android.permission.ACCESS_MEDIA_LOCATION etc. Use * to apply for all permissions.
Sign APK files before installing them.
Set signature schemes, custom signing key, etc.
At least v1 and v2 schemes should be selected for a greater compatibility. v4 scheme requires v2 or v3.
SourceStamp verified and identified to be from %1$s.
Enter the App Manager KeyStore password. If you\'re seeing this for the first time, please use a password generator to generate a password and save it in a secure place before inserting it here.

Insert password for the alias %1$s. You can leave this empty if the password is the same as the KeyStore password.
Tap here to provide password for %1$s
No permission to display app ops
Back up apps with Android KeyStore
Not all apps will work after being restored. Restoring KeyStore doesn\'t work on most devices.
Basic device info including Android system, CPU, GPU, RAM, battery, etc.
Back up APK files from the source directory, including splits.
Back up OBB and media folders.
Back up cache, no_cache and no_backup folders.
Back up app permissions, battery saving and data usage options, MagiskHide status, SSAID, etc. Depending on the permissions, not all extras can be restored.
Back up rules configured within App Manager. Depending on the permissions, not all rules can be reapplied during restore.
Create a separate named backup instead of the base backup.
Restore backups that either fail checksum verification or have different APK signatures than their prior backups.
Sets Ignore mode for the following app ops: RUN_IN_BACKGROUND (from Android 7.0) and RUN_ANY_IN_BACKGROUND (from Android 9).
Select the volume or disk where the backups will be stored.
Could not find any volumes with write permission.
Perform backups only for the specified users
Back up all the installed apps.
Back up apps without any previous backups.
Check integrity of the previous backups and redo backups for which the integrity check-up fails.
Redo backup for installed apps with previous backups.
Redo backups for apps with changes since the last backup. They include changes in size, version, last launch time.
Restore base backup from all backed up apps.
Restore base backup for apps that are not currently installed.
Restore already installed apps whose version codes are higher than the installed version code.
The APKM file is DRM-free, no need to convert it to APKS.
Lock App Manager using Android screen lock
SSAID (Settings.Secure.ANDROID_ID) is a device identifier assigned to each app (from Android 8 \"Oreo\" onwards). It is widely used by apps to track users.
You must restart the device immediately to use the new changes.
Enable or disable features in App Manager.
Please pick a screen lock in the Android settings, or clear app data.

Click on an item to allow or ignore it. Long click on an item to see other supported modes.
These permissions are defined by this app and cannot be revoked.
Click on an item to grant or revoke it. Only dangerous and development permissions may be granted or revoked.
Restrict App Manager to work with the selected users only.

Unlike the volumes, the selected directory will be used to store all the files related to App Manager, including saved APKs and backups. Storage Access Framework (SAF) is very slow, therefore, you should only use this option when others cannot be used.
Volumes with /tree prefix are folders selected using Storage Access Framework (SAF). Except these folders, the default directory for App Manager is a subfolder named AppManager.
The following is the App Manager KeyStore password. Please store it in a secure place if you\'re going to back up/restore App Manager KeyStore. This message will not be displayed again.
Deletes cache files from all applications, including android system
Block tracking components after installing an app using App Manager.
Always install apps in the background and display a notification when finished.
The value must be between 0 to %1$d where 0 means maximum number of operations at the given time.

resources.string: Click on an item to open the log viewer with the corresponding process ID as the default filter.
Select a directory containing the backup files (Swift Backup/Titanium Backup) or directories (OAndBackup)
Generic accessibility service to carry out certain operations such as clearing cache in no-root mode.
Method to use by default in places where there is no option to select a blocking method.\nNote: “IFW” does not work with providers, “disable” is used instead.
Block components using Intent Firewall as well as disable them. Recommended method for root users.
Block components using Intent Firewall only. Not recommended as some system apps can bypass firewalls.
Disable components only. Not recommended for root users since the apps can bypass this. In ADB modes, the test-only apps can be disabled with this method.
Activate the Internet features in App Manager
Depending on the Internet speed and load on the server, this may take a while.
VirusTotal and its logos are a trademark of Chronicle LLC. Neither App Manager—the API client—nor its authors are responsible for any data you may send to VirusTotal.
An API key enables App Manager to upload APK files to VirusTotal as well as fetch reports. Sign up at https://virustotal.com to get an API key for free.
Enable scanning APK files via VirusTotal.

This app contains certain markers that indicate that it might be using Play App Signing. With this scheme, the signing keys are stored in Google\'s servers, and Google is responsible for signing the app. Note that matching signing information is the only way to verify that the app has not been modified by any person other than the developer (and in this case, Google too).
Could not change the app op mode.
Unable to use the current mode of operation. Falling back to no-root mode for this session.
Warning: Working on root instead of ADB mode.
Warning: Working on system instead of ADB mode.
Warn (full-access to the hidden API but issues warnings)
The file was modified. Discard all your changes and exit?
The format to be used for naming the APK files when you save them.

Are you sure? All the third-party apps have to be reconfigured with the new authorization key.

SSAID is a %1$d byte hexadecimal number i.e. a string of length %2$d containing 0 to 9 and a to f.
Display prompt before uploading a file.

Net policy cannot be modified for Android core apps.
Open developer options page in Android settings
Use a completely black background when night mode is enabled.

Delete the backups after importing them to App Manager? Each backup is individually deleted after it is imported with success. Select No if unsure.
Reload the list of apps stored in App Manager database in case of unexpected behaviour.
Find out what\'s new in this release
A valid signing key is required for signing an APK file.
Freezes or unfreezes apps based on state
Method to be used by default in places where there is no option to select a freezing method.
This is the weakest freezing method. A suspended app may still appear in the launcher but will be grayed out and cannot be launched.
Recommended freezing method. It disables the app and along with all its components, but all the shortcuts will be lost.
This method is only recommended for day to day use. A hidden app appears as if it is uninstalled. But the app could reappear if it is reinstalled or updated.
Users, APK name format, parallel execution, etc.
Do not show launched app in Recents
Automatically freeze app when the phone is locked
Waiting for the phone to be locked…

To ensure the safety of your device and data, the version of App Manager you\'re using has been retired. You have to update it to the latest version to continue to use it, or uninstall it if no update is available.
This version of App Manager will expire very soon. Please update it to the latest version.

The app violates W^X policy and is capable of writing and executing in the same directory or in the same portion of memory. This allows the execution of arbitrary executables either by the modification of executables embedded within the app or by downloading them from the Internet. Unless this is the intended behaviour of the app (e.g. terminal emulators), it is recommended to find a newer version of the app that targets SDK 29 (Android 10) and later, or find alternatives.
Select format for exporting app list

We\'re running a funding campaign for App Manager for a limited period. Visit opencollective.com/app-manager to learn more about the campaign. This notice will not be displayed again, but you can find it in the Settings page during the entire campaign.
We\'re running a funding campaign for App Manager for a limited period. learn more…

It looks like USB Debugging is not configured properly. Please read the documentation for additional steps. If you already know the steps, please click “Open” to open the developer options, or click “Close” to continue to use no-root mode.
Allow App Manager to display a floating window on top of all other windows
Allow App Manager to utilise the accessibility feature to track the contents of the leading window.
Consider profile data during DEX optimization
Force compilation even when not required
Optimize DEX and (in Android 10 and later) layouts to improve the performance of the applications.
Aligning an APK file reduces its memory usage as the files in the APK can be accessed directly without copying the data to RAM. This step is required if extractNativeLibs is set to true.
The changes cannot be written into the file, possibly because it is located in a volume that App Manager has no permission to write to. Do you want to save it in a different place?
The application was uninstalled without clearing data and signature. Do you want to completely uninstall it?
Perform DEX optimization immediately after installing the app without waiting for the system to do it when the system is idle.
This folder does not support creating a symbolic link.
An item named “%1$s” already exists in this location. Do you want to replace it?
Could not delete “%1$s” after copying it, possibly due to not enough permission.
Send notifications to the connected devices
Set whether to send notifications to connected devices such as wearables.
Remember last opened path and its position
When this option is enabled, opening a new window opens the last opened folder instead of the home folder.
Run App Manager in the background
Running App Manager in the background reduces initialisation delay. Useful if you use App Manager frequently.
Lock App Manager when the device is locked.
The profile was modified. Discard all your changes and exit?

App Manager is trying to launch the activity via Search assistant (usually Google Assistant), but it\'s unable to do so due to insufficient permission. To open the activity, please activate Search assistant manually (which is usually done by long clicking on the Home button). Click on the Close button after you\'ve finished launching the activity to revert back to the original assistant.
VirusTotal requires the Internet to operate which isn\'t enabled. Please enable “Use the Internet” first.
Please navigate to the developer options to enable wireless debugging and generate a pairing code. Click Manual if you\'ve already opened the developer options.
If you are unable to use any of the modes, you can run the following command in any supported shell to run App Manager in privileged mode:

Use the system-default font instead of the material font. This is an experimental feature.
